content:
DirectoryControlCollection Class

In this Article

The DirectoryControlCollection class manages a collection of DirectoryControl objects.

Syntax

Declaration

public class DirectoryControlCollection : System.Collections.CollectionBase

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.Collections.CollectionBase
  • DirectoryControlCollection

Inherited Members

Constructors summary

DirectoryControlCollection()

The DirectoryControlCollection constructor creates an instance of the DirectoryControlCollection class.

Properties summary

Item(Int32)

The Item property contains the DirectoryControl object at the specified index.

Methods summary

Add(DirectoryControl)

The Add method adds a new DirectoryControl object to the collection.
AddRange(DirectoryControl[])

The AddRange method adds an array of DirectoryControl objects to the collection.
AddRange(DirectoryControlCollection)

The AddRange method adds a DirectoryControlCollection object to the current collection.
Contains(DirectoryControl)

The Contains method determines whether this DirectoryControlCollection object contains a specified DirectoryControl object.
CopyTo(DirectoryControl[],Int32)

The CopyTo method copies the entire collection to a one-dimensional array, starting at the specified index of the target array.
IndexOf(DirectoryControl)

The IndexOf method returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence of the specified DirectoryControl object in the DirectoryControlCollection.
Insert(Int32,DirectoryControl)

The Insert method inserts the specified DirectoryControl object into the DirectoryControlCollection at the specified index.
OnValidate(Object)

The OnValidate method verifies that value is a DirectoryControl object.
Remove(DirectoryControl)

The Remove method removes the first occurrence of the specified DirectoryControl object from the collection.

Constructors

  • DirectoryControlCollection()

    The DirectoryControlCollection constructor creates an instance of the DirectoryControlCollection class.

    public DirectoryControlCollection ();

Properties

  • Item(Int32)

    The Item property contains the DirectoryControl object at the specified index.

    public System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControl this[int index] { get; set; }

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The index value of the DirectoryControl object.

    Property Value

    • DirectoryControl

      Contains the DirectoryControl object at the specified index.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      There was an attempt to set the property to null.

Methods

  • Add(DirectoryControl)

    The Add method adds a new DirectoryControl object to the collection.

    public int Add (System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControl control);

    Parameters

    • control
      DirectoryControl

      The DirectoryControl object to add.

    Returns

    • Int32

      The index of the DirectoryControlCollection at which the DirectoryControl object has been added.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      control is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

  • AddRange(DirectoryControl[])

    The AddRange method adds an array of DirectoryControl objects to the collection.

    public void AddRange (System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControl[] controls);

    Parameters

    • controls
      DirectoryControl[]

      An array of DirectoryControl objects to add to the collection.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      controls is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

    • ArgumentException

      A member of the array is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

  • AddRange(DirectoryControlCollection)

    The AddRange method adds a DirectoryControlCollection object to the current collection.

    public void AddRange (System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControlCollection controlCollection);

    Parameters

    • controlCollection
      DirectoryControlCollection

      The DirectoryControlCollection object to add to this collection.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      controlCollection is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

  • Contains(DirectoryControl)

    The Contains method determines whether this DirectoryControlCollection object contains a specified DirectoryControl object.

    public bool Contains (System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControl value);

    Parameters

    • value
      DirectoryControl

      The DirectoryControl object for which to search.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the specified DirectoryControl object is part of the collection; false, otherwise.

  • CopyTo(DirectoryControl[],Int32)

    The CopyTo method copies the entire collection to a one-dimensional array, starting at the specified index of the target array.

    public void CopyTo (System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControl[] array, int index);

    Parameters

    • array
      DirectoryControl[]

      A one-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements copied from the DirectoryControlCollection object.

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index of array where copying begins.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      array is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      index is less than zero.

    • ArgumentException

      array is multidimensional

      -or-

      The number of elements in the source DirectoryControlCollection is greater than the available space from index to the end of the destination array.

    • InvalidCastException

      The type of the source DirectoryControlCollection cannot be cast automatically to the type of the destination array.

  • IndexOf(DirectoryControl)

    The IndexOf method returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence of the specified DirectoryControl object in the DirectoryControlCollection.

    public int IndexOf (System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControl value);

    Parameters

    • value
      DirectoryControl

      The DirectoryControl object for which the index is returned.

    Returns

    • Int32

      The index value of the specified DirectoryControl object, if found; otherwise, -1.

  • Insert(Int32,DirectoryControl)

    The Insert method inserts the specified DirectoryControl object into the DirectoryControlCollection at the specified index.

    public void Insert (int index, System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControl value);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The index in the collection at which to insert the DirectoryControl object.

    • value
      DirectoryControl

      The DirectoryControl object to be inserted into the collection.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      value is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      index is less than zero, or index is greater than the number of elements in the DirectoryControlCollection object.

    • NotSupportedException

      DirectoryControlCollection is read-only, or DirectoryControlCollection has a fixed size.

  • OnValidate(Object)

    The OnValidate method verifies that value is a DirectoryControl object.

    protected override void OnValidate (object value);

    Parameters

    • value
      Object

      The object to evaluate.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      value is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

    • ArgumentException

      value is not a DirectoryControl object.

    Remarks

    This method does not return a value. Instead, an exception is thrown if the specified object is null or is not a valid DirectoryControl object.

  • Remove(DirectoryControl)

    The Remove method removes the first occurrence of the specified DirectoryControl object from the collection.

    public void Remove (System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControl value);

    Parameters

    • value
      DirectoryControl

      The DirectoryControl object to remove.

    Exceptions

    • NotSupportedException

      DirectoryControlCollection is read-only, or DirectoryControlCollection has a fixed size.
